fields.description:
Jira lets you add custom fields and lets you provide descriptions for those custom fields (to guide users). However the New Issue View in Jira does not use or display these custom field descriptions in any way.

One possible implementation is:

When a user hovers over a field in the new issue view. display a ? which can then be clicked or hovered-over to display the field description text. When the field loses focus then the ? icon disappears to reduce clutter on the screen.

 

Discussed in community post [https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-Software-questions/When-where-do-I-see-the-description-of-a-field-in-the-new-issue/qaq-p/1270966?utm_source=atlcomm&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=immediate_general_reply&utm_content=topic]
fields.summary: Jira New Issue View should display custom field descriptions

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When releasing a version and moving the unresolved issues into the next version, or manually changing the version of a ticket from one version to another JIRA logs this action as two different editions to the *fixVersion* field.

This becomes a problem when users are looking to track issues that changed from one version to another.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create two versions.
# Assign a test issue to one of the versions.
# Access that issue, remove the current version and change it to the second one.

h3. Expected Results

This edition should be covered in one "action", thus, allowing the users to search for issues that were moved from one version to another with something like:
{code}
project = PK and fixVersion changed FROM version1 TO version2 
{code}

h3. Actual Results

Two editions are triggered:
 !fixv.png|thumbnail! 

And it's not possible to use the changed JQL function with *FROM* and *TO* to find the issues that moved to another release.

h3. Workaround

Use two separate *changed* statements like below:
{code}
project = PK and fixVersion changed FROM version1 AND fixVersion changed TO version 
{code}

You may also want to add another filter for fixVersion to make sure you're picking issues that are only within the destination version you're looking for.
fields.summary: Inconsistency on how JIRA changes issues' releases

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The filtering function in the Roadmap in NextGen Project is not working properly. 
 Jira shows the status Category in the filter options but when you apply the filter it is including any Epic with tasks in that status. However, it is desired to filter by Epic Status, not caring about the tasks.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # in Next Gen Project, have one Sprint with tasks in the 3 status category (To do, progress, Done)
 # Apply a filter in the Roadmap
 #Jira always shows this Epic because it is having tasks in all status, ignoring the Epic Status.

h3. Expected Results

Jira should only show the Epics with the statusCategory you filtered.
h3. Actual Results
Jira always shows this Epic because it is having tasks in all status, ignoring the Epic Status
| !image-2020-01-14-10-32-46-064.png|thumbnail! |
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior.
fields.summary: filter Next-Gen Roadmap by epic in status is not working

fields.description:
{panel:title=Update from Roadmaps team - 02 November 2021}
Your feedback that you’ve given here or through other channels has been invaluable in informing our product planning. I want to give you all a brief run-down of what we’ve released so far, what we’re planning on releasing in the future, and areas that we want to hear your specific feedback on.

+Planning from your roadmap: what to expect in the near future+

As you may already know, you can now assign stories to sprints from your roadmap for those working in scrum projects. This was a functionality that was added directly based on your requests, and the response from you all has been very informative and positive. In the near future, we’re planning on releasing a similar solution for Kanban projects that’ll allow you to plan using explicit dates on your roadmap view. We’ll post updates here in the coming weeks about how you can join the early access period for the feature, and give us feedback on that as well. We’re keen to hear what you have to say. 

+Scrum teams that use explicit dates: help us build a better tool+

However, we’re keen to hear from _scrum_ teams who want the ability to plan within sprints, and also explicit dates (different from the sprint start/end dates) to story-level issues on their roadmap, and how intended completion/delivery dates differ from hard deadlines (if at all). If this is you, feel free to email me at [rrichards@atlassian.com|mailto:rrichards@atlassian.com] with your concerns - we’d love to have a conversation where we can dive into the specifics.

I want to reiterate that your feedback has been essential in getting this far, and we’d love to keep hearing from you. Keep an eye on this thread for developments in the near future.

Rathesh | Product Management, Roadmaps.
{panel}
 
h3. Problem

Currently, we can see only the date range for Epics that doesn't include the start and end date of the child issues.
h3. Suggestion

Add the date range separately for each child issues.
fields.summary: Date range for child issues on roadmap

fields.description:
Summary
* Sprint cannot be started if the original board was deleted where the Sprint is initially created.

Steps to replicate:
* Create Two boards in a scrum project and name it as board A and B. 
* Now create Sprint in Board A with some Jira issues. This Sprint should reflect on the *board B*
* Delete board A and try to start the Sprint in board B
* You will receive the following error:
**  !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

Background
* Sprints are global entities that exist across many boards, even if its originating board has been deleted.

Workaround:
* Create a new Sprint on the same board and move the issues to the new Sprint. You will be able to start the Sprint.
fields.summary: Unable to Start Sprint if the originating board is deleted.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Error when ranking issue. Error message could be generic or specific to ranking.

Error can also occur when creating an issue. In this case the issue will be created but the rank is not set correctly and cannot be changed.


This error when data is in an invalid state.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Rank an issue via the board, backlog, or roadmaps

h3. Expected Results

Issue is reranked with no errors and is persistent on refresh

LexoRank integrity check under LexoRank Management is successful
h3. Actual Results

Error shown after ranking issue. If the issue has moved, on refresh it may not be persistent.

LexoRank integrity check under LexoRank Management fails
h3. Workaround

Should create a support ticket for the data integrity problem to be investigated and resolved
fields.summary: Error when ranking issues due to lexorank data integrity problem

fields.description:
Jira cloud software JQL cannot search for issues that do not have linked issues.

If you give a JQL query 'project = xx and linkedIssue is EMPTY' the application will give the below message.

The operator 'is' is not supported by the 'linkedIssue' field.

As per the search options for linkedissue given in "https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/advanced-searching-functions-reference-764478342.html#Advancedsearching-functionsreference-linkedissuelinkedissue", there is no option to search for null or empty linked issues.

As an alternative, the Customer needs to use scriptrunner plugin and use the builtin functions as below.

https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-questions/how-do-i-search-for-issues-without-Issue-Links/qaq-p/300372
fields.summary: JQL does not provide option to query for issues where there are no linked issues

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using the advanced searching options within JQL of Jira Cloud, there exist a number of development functions you can use to search for Jira issues that might have pull requests, commits, branches, and builds. More details in [Advanced searching - developer reference - Atlassian Documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/advanced-searching-developer-reference-967312910.html]
{quote}Source code searches

You can search for issues based on the your development status:
 * development[pullrequests].all (or .open) 
 * development[commits].all
 * development[reviews].all (or .open)
 * development[builds].failing{quote}
However these do not appear to ever return any issues that exist in next-gen projects.

 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Link a Jira Cloud site to a Bitbucket repo via the DVCS connector
 # Create a next-gen scrum project
 # create a sample issue in that project, for example let's say it's NEX-3 is the issuekey for one issue in that project
 # In Bitbucket, create a commit and enter that issuekey (NEX-3) in the commit message
 # You can confirm by visiting the Jira issue directly that this development info is linked to the correct issue.  That part is working as expected.
 # Then go to the issue navigator in Jira Cloud, [yourCloudURL].atlassian.net/issues/ to search under advanced searching for a JQL query such as 
{code:borderStyle=solid}
project=NEX and development[commits].all > 0 
{code}

h3. Expected Results

JQL results should return at least one issue
h3. Actual Results

JQL returns 0 issues from next-gen projects


h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Searching JQL for development info does not work for issues in Next-gen projects

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When typing text in a Jira issue comment, Korean character inputs are sometimes deleted. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
The following text "안녕하세요. 반갑습니다. 텍스트를 입력하다보면 간혹
문자가 입력되지 않거나, 방금 입력한 문자가 사라지는 경우가 발생합니다.".

As you can see on the video ( [^Typing Error (3).mp4] ) from 00:10 to 00:11, the character '거' and 'ㄴ'
are deleted suddenly while typing '않거나' of the above text.

To type the word '않거나', one must press the key in the order that 'ㅇ' → 'ㅏ' →
'ㄴ' → 'ㅎ' → 'ㄱ' → 'ㅓ' → 'ㄴ' → 'ㅏ' and when pressing like this, then it
gets combined into '않거나'.

This problem not only happens to that '않거나', it might happen
to other words in Korean.

Environment: Chrome and Korean language input
Video: [^Typing Error (3).mp4] 

h3. Expected Results
No Korean characters deleted

h3. Actual Results
Korean characters are deleted


h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Korean characters get deleted while typing

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When trying to select a color for a new JQL or trying to change the color for existing ones, it's not possible to select a different color.

If someone selected, for example, Green for the High priority, now it's not possible to change the color to Red.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to a Classic software project board > Board settings
 # On Card colors, try to change the color for current options or to create a new one based on JQL.

h3. Expected Results

It's possible to select any color.
h3. Actual Results

If the color picker is set to Blue, for example, you will be able to only select Blue colors.
h3. Workaround
Edit the color code on the right. It has 3 rows, each represents a color, Red, Green, Blue respectively. To change the color to red, enter the value of *255* on the first row and make the 2nd and 3rd row 0. You can refer to the chart below:
* https://www.rapidtables.com/web/color/RGB_Color.html
fields.summary: Not possible to change card color

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When adding the sprint health gadget to a dashboard, if the option to show assignees in the sprint is enabled it does not update correctly, in that users who did but no longer have issues assigned to them still appear in the list of current assignees in the sprint. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Jira Software project.
 # Create a sprint.
 # Create some issues in the sprint.
 # Assign these issues to 2 or 3 different users.
 # Create a dashboard.
 # Add the sprint health gadget.
 # Select the test sprint created and check the "Show assignees" option and save the gadget.
 # Now go back to the sprint and change the assignees to all be the same user.

h3. Expected Results
The users who no longer have issues assigned to them should not appear in the list of sprint assignees in the sprint health gadget.

h3. Actual Results
Users who have previously been assigned issues but no longer have any assigned to them still appear in the sprint assignee list in the sprint health gadget. 

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Sprint health gadget does not update current assignees in sprint if they no longer have issues assigned to them.

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian status as of August 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#b2d4ff|titleBGColor=#b2d4ff|bgColor=#eaf1fc}
Hello all,

Thank you for watching, voting, and commenting on this ticket.

Now, when you are moving epic(s) from a classic to a next-gen project (or vice versa), you would get a prompt asking if you would like to move the child issues along with the epic(s). The prompt wouldn’t show up if you are already moving all the child issues along with their respective epics at the same time.

Likewise, if you are moving child issue(s) and they have a linked epic, then you will get a warning to tell you that the child issues will lose their epic link.

Example screenshots:

(when moving epics without their children issues)
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!

(when moving children issues without their epic(s))
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail!

We are closing this ticket as resolved. If you feel this issue hasn’t been fully addressed, kindly tell us more about your use case.

Thank you,
 Emily Chan
 Product Manager, Atlassian.
{panel}
h3. Problem Definition

Presently, anytime you convert a project between Next-gen and classic (or vice versa) the epic relationship between the epic and the children issues is not kept. This is documented in [https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/migrate-from-an-next-gen-project-to-a-classic-project-957974933.html]
{quote}Epics: Jira moves your epics across if you map them to an epic issue type in your new project. But, you'll lose the relationship between your epics and their child issues. The child issues themselves will sill exist, but the links between them won't.
{quote}
h3. Suggested Solution

The process to convert between these projects should be able to maintain that relationship between epic and issues in that epic.
h3. Why this is important

Data is lost when converting due to this missing ability.
h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: When migrating between next-gen and classic projects Epic links info is lost and instead conversion should automatically maintain this data link between project types

fields.description:

h3. Workaround
Consider using classic project and refer to the document [Migrate between next-gen and classic projects|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/migrate-from-a-next-gen-project-to-a-classic-project-957974933.html] if you have some tickets on next-gen and need to migrate them to classic project.

fields.description:
At the moment I have a combined swimlane in my project for Stories in the Todo state and in the Ready state. I also have one swimlane for In Progress, one for Code Review and one combined lane for Done and Closed.

If a story is in the In Progress state, you can now drag that story to the Code Review state. You can also drag a story to either Done or Closed, because the drag area is split, which is nice.

You can however not drag a story from Todo to Ready, because they are in the same swimlane and right now dragging within the swimlane only reorders the stories. So the only way you can now move a story from Todo to Ready is:

 1. click the story
 2. click the 3 dots
 3. click "More actions..."
 4. click the dropdown menu
 5. click "To Ready"

This obviously is way to much clicking and especially mouse movement for such a simple and often used action.

It would be nice if there was a way to drag stories from within a swimlane to the other state in that same swimlane, like from Todo to Ready.

Alternatively you could add a right-click context menu item with a shortcut "To Ready".
fields.summary: As user I want to be able to move Stories in the Todo/Ready swimlane from Todo to Ready by dragging or from the right-click context menu, to reduce the time I need to spend on JIRA.

h3. Issue Summary
On the board of a classic Kanban project the Assignee Filter lists users who are not assignees, nor have anything related to the project. Please see related support ticket.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Could not reproduce the problem so far. One thing I could find is that the unrelated user used to be the reporter of an issue on the board, but changing the reporter of that issue did not remove the user from the filter.

h3. Actual Results

fields.summary: Assignee Filter on classic Kanban board shows unrelated users

fields.description:
It would be really nice if we are able to use any Global Rank field type as the secondary sort on my Kanban boards. I can see this happening in one of two ways:

Allow JQL statements like "ORDER BY priority DESC, Rank ASC", but require the user to specify the name of the rank field (possibly a prepopulated dropdown of the existing sorting fields in the query/filter). The problem with this approach is handling the UX for drag'n'drop reordering, which would be sensitive to the context of the primary sort.
Create another Rank field type, or allow the current one, to default to a particular value (like 0 or the maximum integer value) instead of auto-incrementing the value each time an issue is created. This would allow the system to treat sorting statements the same - "ORDER BY Rank ASC, priority DESC" - while allowing a "default" ranking to take place until the rank value is set (by dragging and dropping a card higher on the list)
fields.summary: Allow Rank field to be used as a secondary sort parameter

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Unable to change sprint name in next-gen projects when using a language other than English

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a next-gen project and activate the following features:
** backlog
** sprint
# Set your Jira language to any other language but English
# Navigate to "バックログ(backlog)"
# Click the three dot icon next to either of the sprint and select "スプリントを編集(edit sprint)"
# Enter a new name and click "保存(save)"

h3. Expected Results
The sprint name is updated

h3. Actual Results
An error telling something went wrong is shown and the sprint name isn't updated.

In the server side, the following error is shown. The error message indicates that the start and end dates don't have a valid value set, however, there are no fields to set dates in the edit sprint screen.
{code}
JiraCopiedRestErrorCollection[errorMessages=[],errors={endDate='None' は有効な日付ではありません。次の形式で日付を入力してください: yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ, startDate='None' は有効な日付ではありません。次の形式で日付を入力してください: yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ}]
{code}
 
h3. Workaround
Change the Jira language to English
fields.summary: Editing the sprint name in next-gen project fails when using other language than English

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

On the Jira project we allow users to add duplicate repositories as an Item. See screen shot attached as an example
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to your Jira project
 # Click on "Add Item"
 # Repository > Add 
 # Enter the repository link and Connect it

You are able to repeat this process on the same project multiple times for the same repository and that repository item will be added to the project same number of times
h3. Expected Results

I would expect that once the repository was added, next time the user tries to add it we should say that this Item has already been added and not allow the user to add it again. 

And removing that Item is not very intuitive,  the Icon looks like a Sync/Refresh instead of Settings or Options you have for it and hovering over it doesn't prompt you on what you expect to happen if you press on it.  I think this behavior can be improved by updating the Icon, Added a prompt on when you hover over it ...
h3. Actual Results

Able to add duplicate Items on the Project View and its not intuitive how to remove it
h3. Workaround

Workaround is to remove a duplicate once it was added by clicking on the Refresh/sync  Option > then Edit Repository > Delete
fields.summary: When you select Add Item  on a Jira project, you are able to add duplicate repositories from Bitbucket

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When viewing a Sub-Task from the Board view, the page can sometimes reload and create some form of a hybrid Issue where the parent Task key will be displayed but content from the child Sub-Task will be displayed.

When this happens, any changes done to the Sub-Task in this state will also be saved in the parent Task.

 !2019-12-05_17-33-18.gif|width=400&height=200!

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# On a Next-gen Project in the Board view, open a Task Issue with Sub-Tasks
# On the parent Task, click on one of its child Sub-Tasks
# Go to the next tab on your browser, then go back to the tab with Jira
# Make any changes to the Sub-Task

This seems to happen randomly for various reasons but with these steps, you can reproduce this 100% of the time. This is a variation of the bug in JSWCLOUD-18616. It only occurs on a Next-gen Project.

h3. Expected Results

When you go back to Jira after being on another tab, you should be on the same Sub-Task and any changes done will be saved on the Issue.

h3. Actual Results

# The window reloads
# The Issue key of the Sub-Task is converted into the parent Task's Issue key ( !NGFF.png|thumbnail! )
# Any changes done in this state will be saved on both the child Sub-Task and the parent Task

h3. Workaround

No actual workaround. You have to reload the child Sub-Task again by opening the parent Task or opening it directly in the Issue details view.
fields.summary: Sub-Task overwrites parent Task data on Next-gen Projects

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

h4. Method 1
When navigating in the backlog, you can click on an issue to open its detail view, which will show its fields, as well as its sub-tasks.

When you click on a sub-task, it will open the sub-task, its detail view will open replacing the parent view.

But, if you click on the description of the sub-task, and navigate a little between the content before the whole content has been loaded into the screen, the following will happen:
* The sub-task's key in the breadcrumb will be replaced by the parent key:
 !Screen Shot 2019-12-04 at 11.34.45.png|thumbnail! 
* If you save the description, the parent issue will inherit that content, losing its own.

h5. Steps to Reproduce
* Click on an issue that has sub-tasks in the backlog;
* Click on the sub-task;
* Before the content of the description/page is fully loaded, click on the description field of the sub-task, and start navigating on it.

h5. Expected Results

The content should just load, without changing the key of the sub-task in the breadcrumb. And the content of the sub-task should not impact in the content of the parent.

h5. Actual Results

The key of the sub-task is changed in the breadcrumb, and saving its description will send that content to the parent issue.

*Observations:* 
* It is easier to replicate if your environment is slow, or if the description has a huge amount of content to be loaded (e.g. images). I have replicated the problem using virtual box with Windows 10;
* I was not able to replicate in Classic projects, only Next-gen so far.

See the recording:  [^Description overwritten.mp4] 

h4. Method 2
When opening an issue on the board, if you open an issue in the modal view, then opening the child issue from there, you can also reproduce the same behavior.

h5. Steps to Reproduce
* Click on an issue that has sub-tasks and open the parent issue on the board;
* Click on one of the sub-tasks;
* Write the description with text and a bullet-point list;
* Scroll up and down in the issue screen;
* Click in the description field to edit
Video: https://share.getcloudapp.com/d5uee12L

h5. Expected Results

Same as of method 1.

h4. Method 3
When opening an issue on the board, if you open an issue in the modal view, then opening the child issue from there, and switching tabs in the browser can also cause this behavior.

h5. Steps to Reproduce
* Open two tabs in the browser, one being Jira, and the other can be any other page;
* In Jira, click on an issue that has sub-tasks and open the parent issue on the board;
* Click on one of the sub-tasks;
* Write some text in the description;
* Switch to the other tab, and return to Jira;
Video: https://share.getcloudapp.com/12uDD4Ee

h5. Expected Results

Same as of method 1 and 2.


h3. Workaround

For method 1, you can avoid that problem by waiting for the page to fully load.
For method 2, there isn't any feasible workaround.
For method 3, you can avoid it by not switching tabs while editing the sub-task description.
fields.summary: Sub-task's description will overwrite parent's description if you click and save its description before the content is loaded in the detail view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When starting newsprint in the Next-gen template, the entered start date and end time are adjusted to GMT+0 instead of respecting the site time zone setting.
 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# First ensure you site timezone is not GMT+0
# Go to next-gen project
# Click backlog
# Start new sprint
# Select custom  date from the pop-up screen
# Enter start and end date
# Click start

h3. Expected Results
A new sprint is started showing the start and end dates entered by the user

h3. Actual Results
The date time is changed by adjusting the date to GMT+0

h3. Workaround
After starting the sprint, go to the backlog view and edit the sprint with the correct date and time.
fields.summary: Next gen Sprint start and end date changes to GMT+0

fields.description: Our organization has applied a number of customizations to Jira Issues which force users to perform specific actions at certain points in the workflow. We've noticed that users are able to bypass those actions by using the Bulk edit, move, or transition functionality. We'd like to see if it is possible to allow Jira system administrators to edit or configure the bulk functionality in some way so that we can add the same customizations to those pages in addition to adding the functionality to the issues themselves.

fields.description:
As an RTE (new to JA, coming from Rally), I need to be able to get a quick view of iteration status (iterations Status view in Rally) for my entire train. This includes percentages shown for amount accepted, points committed vs what is current at time of view. 

Currently in JA, other than the Program Board which is ok but at the feature level, I have to go to an iteration status window, and then have to go through a drop down and scroll through and find the correct team and sprint I want to look at. These types of views should really, by default, bring you to the current iteration and if some other iteration is needed, go look for that. I also want this to be a single view for my entire train (Program level) and not have to look up each team individually/
fields.summary: Jira Align - Default to current Iterations on views

fields.description:
The Qt Company is a JIRA user and we made in the EU funded OpenReq project, a new plug-in called Issue Link Map tool.

This aims to add functionality to our Jira by visualizing existing links, recommending missing links and checking the consistency of linked issues in regard to their release schedule. The prototype was developed in cooperation with the University of Helsinki (UH) and Universitat Politècnica de Catalunya, Barcelona (UPC).

After the EU project, ending 2019, The Qt Company wants to be a user of this kind Issue Link Map tool JIRA plugin. But we don’t have resources enough for maintenance and possible continuation feature development. Our purpose is to find some facet from the Atlassian community to make this work in the future and put it available to the marketplace. We made market analysis and there is no this kind of solution/plugin available yet. So, this can be a good opportunity for someone.

All materials and source codes are available in GitHub. Prototype repository: 

[https://github.com/OpenReqEU/issuelinkmap-jira-plugin] 

If you want to know how the services work, check out the OpenReq Github: [https://github.com/OpenReqEU] 

 

The OpenReq project is a 100% EU funded Horizon 2020 research project about requirements and decision making that Qt is participating in as a project member. More information: [https://openreq.eu/] 

Hopefully, we can find someone for this development issue.
fields.summary: Development for new Jira plugin: Issue Link Map tool

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
On a next gen board, change status of an issue via Bento issue view

Issue does not transition to the expected column 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
On next gen board, change status of an issue via Bento issue view
* When I move an issue in issue bento view, it’ll fire a call to the transition end point to update the status, if this endpoint is still waiting for a response when I close Bento, the column status is not udpated
* When I wait for the response to come back, then close Bento, the issue status is correctly reflected

Expected:

Issue transitions immediately

Notes:

Seems to be more easily reproduceable on large instances like Jdog or Hello/j, harder on smaller staging instances but still possible

h3. Expected Results
Issue transitions immediately

h3. Actual Results
Occasionally does not update. Seems more easily reproduceable on large instances than smaller ones

h3. Workaround

Refresh the board
fields.summary: Optimistic update on board does not update column status correctly

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In Next-Gen projects, when leaving a sub-task screen opened for more than 2 minutes, the key ID switches automatically to display the parent key ID.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Story with a child issue and assign it to the active sprint
 # In the board view, open the Story
 # In the pop-up view screen open the child issue
 # Leave it open without action for around 2 minutes
 # The issue key ID will change to the parent ID, insert a comment or any action.

h3. Expected Results
That the screen remains with the child key ID and comments or updates are applied to the child issue.

h3. Actual Results
The key ID changes to the parent ID and the updates are applied to the parent issue.

h3. Workaround
 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Leaving a sub-task screen opened for more than 2 minutes, the key ID switches to display the parent key ID

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Hi Team,

 

I have noticed an interesting behaviour I would like to report. I have created a next get jira board (main) that pulls the issues from multiple projects. What I have noticed is that if the issues have a Epic associated with it, it does not appear in the main project boards backlog. But If I remove the Epic, it appears in the backlog.

 

My main board: [https://hello.atlassian.net/secure/RapidBoard.jspa?rapidView=3848&view=planning&selectedIssue=CSC-11]

 

Querry: project in (PUR, A1C, CSC, MARVIN) AND resolution is EMPTY AND "Commerce Teams" = "High Touch" OR labels = HighTouch ORDER BY priority DESC, cf[17980] ASC

 

In the CSC Projects which the main board pulls from, the issues have Epics associated with it. When I take out the Epic from for example, [https://hello.atlassian.net/browse/CSC-11], it appears in the backlog. But other issues which appear from the results of the query are not shown in the backlog, for example, [https://hello.atlassian.net/browse/CSC-12], as they have an Epic associated with it.

 

What would be the best way to report this behaviour? Or has this been reported before?
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to the Filter query on this board [https://hello.atlassian.net/secure/RapidBoard.jspa?rapidView=3848&view=planning&selectedIssue=CSC-11]
 # Step 2: Notice that stories for CSC are appearing in the query, eg.g CSC-12
 # Go to the Backlog view on the project. Notice that the CSC-12 is not appearing on the backlog. This is because it still has an epic assciated with it on project board: [https://hello.atlassian.net/jira/software/projects/CSC/boards/3837]
 # Notice on the Backlog that CSC-11 is appearing on the backlog. This because it has not Epic associated with it on project [https://hello.atlassian.net/jira/software/projects/CSC/boards/3837]

h3. Expected Results

The issues types that appear in the Filter query should appear on the Backlog of the project
h3. Actual Results

The backlog does not have all the issues that appear in the Filter query 
h3. Workaround

Current work around is I take the Epics of the issue types I want to appear on the board
fields.summary: Issues not appearing on Backlog of project

fields.description: As a user, I'd like to customize workflows in Next-Gen projects to add post-functions and other advanced settings at the workflow to copy field values and other options like it is possible for Classic Workflows.
fields.summary: Advanced workflow configuration like post-function, triggers and options

fields.description:
It would be great if the progress bar that shows was weighted by story points. It is misleading when many small subtasks remain and the bulk of the hard tasks are done yet the progress bar shows a low percent completion.

Also the subtasks seem to be ordered by descending creation order. This should be the ranking that is shown in the board view and it should be possible to reorder in this view as well.
fields.summary: Improve subtasks display in new issue view (next gen)

fields.description:
As a user, I'd like to see the Sprint Burndown report that is available in Next-Gen projects in Classic Projects.

The report contains full information and allows ordering issues based on the column which Classic Reports don't allow.

It would be great having the same report for Classic Projects.
fields.summary: As a user, I'd like to see the Sprint Burndown report that is available in Next-Gen projects in Classic Projects

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Once you add a default reporter to an e-mail handler, that default reporter can not be removed from it.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new e-mail handler (tested with "Add comment to the entire email body" and "Create a new issue or add a comment to an existing issue")
 # Add a Default Reporter to the handler and save it
 # Click to edit the e-mail handler and try to remove the Default Reporter by erasing the field value

h3. Expected Results

The Default Reporter should be removed
h3. Actual Results

Although you are able to erase the field and save it, the default reporter is still there after you click to save.
h3. Workaround

Delete the handler and create a new one.
fields.summary: The Default reporter can not be removed from E-mail handlers

fields.description: We need functionality where we can create multiple issues with the new line. Currently, this functionality exists in team-managed (formerly next-gen) project only.
fields.summary: Create issue for every new line in company-managed project

fields.description:
To link an issue you need to either rely on the search revealing good results or you need to have the issue key.

Unfortunately the search results are not always great, leaving you with no results.

So you need to paste the issue key. But here again there is no quick possibility to do that. But you can copy the issue URL quickly to your clipboard. So I'd like to either
 * the possibility to also quickly copy the issue key
 * or to paste the issue URL also in the link issue field
fields.summary: Allow pasting an issue URL into the link issue field

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The issue is that my team quite often write long descriptions and using the Jira Cloud next-gen software, we are now having to scroll to the top of our descriptions each time we want to add a new image into the body.

In the previous version of Jira, the toolbar was a sticky bar that would scroll with the page which would prevent this being an issue.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow the toolbar to flex in display so that it stays with the user when they write very long comments

h3. Why this is important
It can save users a lot of unnecessary scrolling when it comes to next-gen issues.  

h3. Workaround 
Once the issue is created, you can type /image in order to bring up this media attachment directly.
fields.summary: Next-gen issues should have the toolbar always displayed on screen while the description is being edited

fields.description: As a manager, I would love to see the ability to expand/link a single kanban board column into a full kanban board (or sub-kanban board). We have a large number of work flow steps that are grouped together in some of our kanban board columns. Linking that column to a related sub-kanban board would give greater visibility of the more detailed workflows.
fields.summary: Kanban board column links to a sub-kanban board

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When trying to link a Confluence page to a Sprint or Sprint Report using the system Application Link, the following message is displayed:
!Image 2019-11-19 at 11.53.38 AM.png|thumbnail! 
This also does not work as expected when trying to link from the Backlog, as it redirects to Confluence but nothing happens.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Jira instance with Confluence;
# Checking if the System Application Link is created;
# Create a project, an issue, and a Sprint and complete the Sprint;
# Try to link a Confluence Page to the Sprint.

h3. Expected Results

The option to browse through the Confluence Page will be displayed.

h3. Actual Results

The error message *"No Confluence server is configured. Please check your Application Links configuration."* is displayed.

h3. Workaround

Try the `Refresh all Application Links` link (top right wheel icon above the applinks table) by going to https://<tenant>.atlassian.net/plugins/servlet/customize-application-navigator
fields.summary: Linking Confluence Pages to Sprints is not finding the system Application Link

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When a Software board is based on a classic software project and the workflow is managed by Jira software ([Simplified workflow|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/using-the-simplified-workflow-764478004.html]), if the Cloud instance has a Next-gen project, while trying to add a new status to that board, Jira will also show statuses from the Next-gen projects.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open the board configuration of a Software board based on a classic software board that uses the Simplified workflow;
# Open the column settings, then click *Add status*;

h3. Expected Results
Jira will show only statuses that are used by classic projects.

h3. Actual Results
Next-gen statuses are also displayed to be mapped.

 !JSWCLOUD-18582-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
The board admin just needs to click on one of the statuses. Jira will find the correct "classic" status.

 !JSWCLOUD-18582-2.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: If using simplified workflow, when adding a new status to the board, Jira will also list Next-gen statuses (duplicates)

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Adding image attachments to the description field in a next-gen project always has the image appear to the full width of the screen.  There is no way to adjust the size of that image as it appears in the description.  This is possible to do in classic projects, either with the thumbnail or other img tags (width, height, etc).

h3. Suggested Solution
Implement some way to let end users that can edit the description the ability to resize in-line image attachments that appear there.

h3. Why this is important
Not all images are created equally.  Some of these are very large, or mis-porportioned in a way that makes them appear undesirably large on the page.   In the current setup, all images are treated exactly the same


h3. Workaround 
None currently possible within next-gen projects
fields.summary: When adding an image to a description, I want to be able to resize the image that appears there

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

JSON import is skipping "issuetype" parameter in team-managed projects.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a Next-Gen project;
# Ensure that the issue type *Bug* is added to it.
# Try to import this JSON file:  [^dummy.json] 

h3. Expected Results

The issue will be imported as a Bug.

h3. Actual Results

The issue will be imported as a Story.

h3. Workaround

If importing multiple issues, import them into a company-managed and then move the issues to a team-managed [as described in this documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/migrate-between-next-gen-and-classic-projects-957974933.html].
fields.summary: JSON import is skipping "issuetype" parameter in team-managed projects.
Issue linking via Rest API does not honor the name and id of the issue link

fields.description:
h4. +Summary+
When Swimlanes are based on Epics and there are Issues linked to Epics which are not available in the board, then these Issues are still visible in Backlog (for Scrum) & Kanban Backlog (Kanban) but invisible in Active Sprints (both Scrum and Kanban)

h4. +Steps to reproduce+
# Create board A (Scrum) for project A, which should filter all issues in project A
# Create project B, then create Epic B in project B
# Create Issue A in project A, then link it to Epic B
# Create a sprint in board A, add Issue A to it and start it
# Configure board A and base Swimlanes on Epics

h4. +Expected behavior+
Issue A is visible in Active Sprints of board A

h4. +Actual behavior+
Issue A is invisible in Active Sprints of board A

(i) If Issue Count is enabled for the Columns, we can see a mismatch in the number of issues like this:
!activesprint.png|thumbnail!

In Backlog mode, all the 4 issues are visible:
!backlog.png|thumbnail!

h4. +Notes+
(!) The same behavior applies to both Scrum and Kanban boards

h4. +Original Description+
{panel}
We have put some stories in our sprint that are connected to epics from an "Epics" project, which contains Epics that span multiple projects. 

The Saved Filter for the board is the default:
project = "This Project" ORDER BY Rank ASC

In "plan" mode I can see the tasks
In "work" mode when we select "swimlanes by epic" these stories disappear. They also do not show under "issues without epics". 

The workaround suggested elsewhere is to change the Saved Filter to:
project = "This Project" OR ( project = Epics AND type = epic ) ORDER BY Rank ASC

However, this then means that when you go to "plan" mode and show the Epics panel, you then see all multi-project Epics, even if they do not have any tasks in the current project.
{panel}
fields.summary: Stories from external epics disappear in swimlanes

fields.description: In a standard Jira environment, using Sub-tasks as a means of tracking work, provide a feature in 'Board' configuration that allows the Sub-tasks to be hidden/un-hidden for a specific Issue.  For example, a team is reviewing work  but would like a cleaner view to better facilitate conversation.  On one specific issue with eight sub-tasks, the driver of the board is able to enable this feature and +all+ sub-tasks associated with this Issue, regardless of location, are collapsed from view.  Once completed, the toggle is reversed and the Sub-tasks are placed back into the original location.
fields.summary: Enable a "hidden view" for sub-tasks

fields.description:
When an App is uninstalled the add-on user remains in the database. If customer tries to mention it in a comment it appears.

It is expected that the add-on user is deleted after App is uninstalled.

There is no way to delete it in the UI as it is a system user.
fields.summary: Add-on users are not deleted after App is uninstalled.

fields.description:
In Jira 8.3, Issue Author is automatically, and irreversibly a Watcher on an issue.

As a developer, I find issues in software that I need to report, but I don't necessarily want to know every time a change to that issue happens.  This is especially true when .  

Often, I've fulfilled my responsibility by *reporting the issue*.  If $MGMT or $PRODUCT_OWNER doesn't think the issue is worthwhile, that's fine.

 

DoD:
 * Creating a new Issue does not automatically make me a watcher.
 * I can configure whether I want to be a watcher automatically for issues I create.

 
----
I think the "Component/s" field is wrong, but I couldn't figure out which one was pertinent.
fields.summary: Issue author *does not have to be* watcher automatically

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The assignee quick filter buttons can show an unwanted user, if you have a sub-tasks falling under the board filter query, the assignee from the parent will be shown as a button *even if his issue is not showing at the board at all*

(btw these are the buttons)
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a board with a filter that include sub-tasks
# Create a ticket that *doesn't match the board filter criteria*
# Create sub-tasks for that ticket *that does match under the board filter criteria*
# Check the assignee buttons


h3. Expected Results
The assignee buttons only show people who actually have issues in the board

h3. Actual Results
The assignee buttons show the assignee of the ticket from *Step 2* even though that assignee has no issue in the board.

h3. Workaround
None
fields.summary: Board assignee quick filter can show unwanted user due to parent relation

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Change to be made in Search to account for Next-gen subtask to parent relationship as it currently only looks at the classic relationship.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
Create a sprint
Add an issue to the sprint
Add subtasks to the issue
Go to GIN
Search based on the JQL "sprint = <Your sprint>"
h3. Expected Results
The result set includes your issue as well as the subtasks.
h3. Actual Results
Subtasks are not included in the result
h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: JQL with a sprint clause does not return Next-gen subtasks
When creating an issue on a board with filtered options, the issues created on it should inherit that settings

fields.description: The Jira software is not at all accessible to visually impaired programmers using screen readers. I am in fact not even able to use this page using JAWS; i am doing it with the help of a sighted person. Can you please take the necessary steps to make Jira accessible as there are blind programmers all around who are being impacted due to this and need to depend on sighted assistance to do the basic things?
fields.summary: Accessibility issues in Jira for visually impaired programmers using screen readers

fields.description:
While creating an Epic in a team-managed (formerly next-gen) project, I would like to edit the color of that issue.

While I can configure view "Create issue" to show field "Issue color", the actual field cannot be edited. Instead, the default color is only shown.

!issueColorCreation.png|thumbnail!

It would be nice if the color value was editable.
fields.summary: Allow to edit issue color when creating Epic in team-managed (formerly next-gen) project

fields.description:
On the old issue view, if you click on *+* button to create an issue under an epic, Jira will display the create issue pop-up where you can choose a different project for this issue. 
 !create in epic.png|thumbnail! 

On the New issue view, this functionality is not present:

fields.description:
Hi all, I`m contacting with you because when I modify the due date of an initiative, this change in the roadmap is not reflected, only the bar is enlarged, but it would be good if it could be extended with another color, for example red, to understand that I had a due date originally estimated and then had to be modified.

 

Best regards.
fields.summary: Aditional features for roadmaps on next gen projects.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Using hyphens on a filter name doesn't return the result when creating (or editing) a board from filters.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to your Issue navigator Search
 # Search for some issues e.g. _project=ABC ORDER BY Rank ASC_
 # Create a filter name using hyphens e.g. Atlas-Test-Filters-One
 # Attempt to create a Board using the filter name above.

h3. Expected Results
The filter name should be returned as the result for selection and hyphenated filter name shouldn't be excluded from the search result.

h3. Actual Results
 * In a Instance that has less filters. by simply calling "A" alone, you can get the search result to return the values of all the filters but when you type e.g. "Alpha-T" => any text after the hyphen, in this case ("T") the results are removed.
 * In a larger Instance, no result are returned at all.

||BEFORE||AFTER||
|!board0.png|thumbnail!|!board.png|thumbnail!|
|search pattern : *Atlas-* (!)|search pattern : *Atlas-T* (x)|

h3. Workaround
 * Not using hyphens in your Filter name.
fields.summary: Hyphenation on Filter Name doesn't return Search result when creating a Board from filters

fields.description:
At the moment, we can focus on the statuses either of stories or of subtasks on the next-gen Sprint board; but not on both at the same time:

When we group the issues on the next-gen board by "None", we see all the stories and are able to manage their statuses by moving the stories to the corresponding columns. For instance, we can move a story from column To Do to column In Progress to change its status accordingly. However, when grouping by "None", _no subtasks are shown_.

As soon as we group the issues by subtask, subtasks are shown and we can move those subtasks across the board. However, then it is not possible anymore to move stories that have subtasks. _Only stories without subtasks can be moved across the board._

Is there any way to show stories and their corresponding subtasks on the next-gen board at the same time – and to be able to move both stories and subtasks between the columns?
fields.summary: Allow to move both stories and subtasks across next-gen board at the same time

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If a custom field with the same field name exists in a Next-Gen project, new issue types cannot be added. The following message is displayed in the logs:
{noformat}Error Messages: [Field with the same name already exists for this project.]{noformat}


h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a Next-Gen project;
# Create a custom field with the same name as a system field, for example, *Resolution* and save the changes.
# Try to add the Issue Type.

Check this short video reproducing the behavior: [^Screen Recording 2019-11-06 at 06.10 PM.mov] 

h3. Expected Results

Jira should not allow custom fields to be created with the same name as system fields.

h3. Actual Results

An error message is displayed when trying to add the issue type.

h3. Workaround

Rename any custom fields that could be related to system fields. If you are not sure which ones, please raise a [ticket with Atlassian Support|https://support.atlassian.com/contact/]
fields.summary: If a custom field with the same field name exists in a Next-Gen project, new issue types cannot be added

fields.description:
h3. Summary

It is possible to perform some actions in an issue by using the *Actions (...)* button on a card when viewing the board of a Next-gen project.

Currently, the button is not working for non-admin.

Members should be able to see the menu since they can edit issues as well.

h3. Environment

Jira Cloud.

h3. Steps to reproduce

* Log in as an user that has the *Member* role set in a Next-gen project;
* Access the board of that project;
* Click on the *Actions (...)* button on a card.

h3. Expected results

The menu with the possible options (action) will be displayed.

h3. Actual results

Nothing happens when you click on the button.

See the recording:  [^Actions button behaviour.mp4] 

h3. Workaround

Click on the card itself to open the issue detail view and perform the actions you need:
 !Screen Shot 2019-11-06 at 14.13.58.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Actions button does not work for non-admin users in Next-gen projects
